entry.def: Someone or something that is respectable is approved of by society and considered to be morally correct.

example.ex: He came from a perfectly respectable middle-class family...
example.tran: 他出身于一个非常正派的中产阶级家庭。

example.ex: It was a highly respectable and what was called an 'old-fashioned' hotel situated not far from Piccadilly.
example.tran: 这是一家非常体面的“老式”旅馆，坐落在离皮卡迪利广场不远的地方。

entry.tran: 好的;可观的;令人满意的
entry.def: You can say that something is respectable when you mean that it is good enough or acceptable.

example.ex: ...investments that offer respectable rates of return...
At last I have something respectable to wear!
example.tran: 我终于可以穿上体面的衣服了！

sentences.sentence: "he did respectably well for his age"

means.word_mean: 2. in a decent and morally reputable manner;

sentences.sentence: "the film ends with the middle-aged romancers respectably married"

auth_sentence.content: I like people who express respectably their ideas, but there are others so rude to express their thoughts.

auth_sentence.content: "If the girls were dressed respectably, no-one would touch them," one of them said.
